author: poojaranjan
content:
**EIPIP Meeting 91**
Date and Time: Oct 04, 2023 at 14:00 UTC
Agenda: https://github.com/ethereum-cat-herders/EIPIP/issues/278

author: poojaranjan
content: Feel free to add items for discussion.

author: abcoathup
content: It's application layer, so an ERC in my mind.

author: gcolvin
content:
The one thing I really have time to care about today is this:
> 6. determine the numbering rule for ERCs
> 
>     in the short term this will be a spreadsheet where the next sequential number is assigned by an editor. Though this still has issues of number gaming. Alternatively if editors have discretion then there could be a perception of preferential treatment to insiders.

author: gcolvin
content: I'm not sure how the editor's assigning numbers sequentially is open to gaming, and had thought that we were going to automate this.

author: joeysantoro
content: that was my instinct as well

author: abcoathup
content:
Numbers are assigned sequentially from the spreadsheet but editors can assign to unnumbered EIP/ERCs in any order (which has already happened).  So there is potential for the perception of special treatment if a memorable number is assigned out of order.

Automation leads to the potential for author gaming to claim a memorable number by submitting a PR quickly (or using a bot) to claim the next sequential number.

author: abcoathup
content:
The EIP/ERC numbering spreadsheet had duplicate numbers.  Pretty sure it must have been me dragging the column down and not checking they numbers were sequential.

<@474796222738202636> you issued a number that had already been issued.  I have issued a new number: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/7815

There were two EIP/ERCs awaiting numbers, I believe we should issue in order of when PRs are created, but we don't have a rule on this.
